reviews.review_msg: always has a lot to talk about the subject, so you learn much more than what is in the slides. Comparing with previous terms he is updating his teachings slids and assignments every term to match his style better. You will learn alot of programming since he loves hands-on approach it seems.

He is very enthusiastic about the topic and try to convey that to students. Try to review the material before going to lectures. He posts alot of stuff. So being prepared gets that much farther in learning when he is discussing the material. Be prepared to work hard.

Honestly this course would improve alot if he organized the course, got rid of the quizzes and structured the slides to fit his teaching style instead of ripping off Berkeley. I think if he implemented these changes he would be honestly a great prof.

Hello how does he have 3 rating. It should be at like 0. No hate to the guy. Buddy is nice and all. Feel bad for the hate he gets sometimes too. BUT he does not know how to teach. Like I am not joking. In terms of learning, this class is absolute trash. Nothing he says makes any sense, and i m not tryna to overexaggerate here. dont take it with him

Absolutely insane. So unorganized and uninterested. Would not reply to important emails and doesn't even know how to do a simple question himself (blamed Berkeley's answers to be wrong). Made our final diabolically hard for no reason, and added a question in the midterm which no one could self, including him. SFU do better.

Extremely unclear about directions. will give different, contrasting information in lectures, emails, and tutorials. Seems very confused in lectures, like they don't know what they are doing.

If you're reading this, please organize your information better, don't make receiving course information a scavenger hunt.
I just started out with him and after the first lecture I had to drop, it was probably one of the worst lectures I had at SFU. To be honest, I have no clue how he is a prof. NEVER TAKE!
I do not recommend!

What he taught us was not sufficient for the exams. The lecture slides are mostly Berkeley lectures. The final was a disaster(the worst final in my entire degree) but still managed to get a good score due to his lenient marking. The lectures were kinda boringâ€¦one can easily study everything from UC Berkeley.
he is okay, but this course overall requries too much self studying and reading with him.
He's the GOAT
Great prof. Funny and caring. Looks good in a leather jacket. yes.
GOAT. Made challenging concepts seem easy. Super funny and caring. Really cool assignments too, and the exams are difficult but fair.
very good prof

Just a copy paste of uv Berkeley and stills manages to mess everything up. Exams are nothing like the Berkeley ones or practice samples as he changes them to a point that only he can understand. Save yourself from him.

Please do not take this course with him. Man does not know what he is teaching. He just knows how to yap and dodge questions. Copies everything from UC Berkeley. Also, someone should tell him that he is not funny.

In CMPT 310, I found my stride,
With Nezami there to be my guide.
From AI paths to search and play,
He made the hardest things feel okay.

The code we wrote was not just code,
But steps along a thinker's road.
Assignments tough, yet somehow fair,
With just enough of challenge there.
Took his course, leveled up. Brain went brrr. 10/10 would recommend. If you miss out? That's a you problem. ðŸ˜¤
Midterms and final were super fair â€” no surprises. If you go to class and review slides, you'll be fine. He doesn't try to catch students off guard like some other profs.

Exams were fair, focused more on understanding than memorization. Assignments were challenging but doable if you keep up. He's really responsive via email and is open to questions â€” never made anyone feel dumb for asking something.

Honestly one of the best profs I've had at SFU. Dr. Nezami explains concepts like minimax, CSPs, and adversarial search in a super clear way and actually makes AI feel approachable. He uses real-world examples and gives lots of helpful hints before assignments. The slides are super well-organized and he actually cares if students are learning.
My Glorious King. Ignore the bad reviews.

Terrible experience. During the entire semester I had no idea what is going on all thanks to reza. Save yourself from torture and wasting money. There are tons of other reviews I would recommend reading so that you know how great the prof is and why you should avoid him

Reza is such a bad prof. Ya maybe he is a nice person, even the nicest person out there. But i dont care. Its horrible to learn with him. he doesn't know how to teach whatsoever, i would never suggest anyone taking the course with him. Its horrible. I don't know I passed. If you want to learn anything, you gotta learn it by yourself sadly.

He cant teach, literally everything was from UC Berkeley from lectures to asssignments. Do not trust his sample questions for both midterm and finals as they are no where near the questions appeared on the paper.

Man does not know anything. His slides are from berkley so he legit doesn't know what he's talking about sometimes. Always : uhhh, ahhhuuuh, umm yeah so ... Like does he want us to learn? Even more, he has practice problems with no solutions, if he does make solutions they are unreadable. theres writing all over the place and over the question.

He doesn't know what he's talking about, literally read of the sldies then add a few filler words that makes no sense. Dogded questions if there were any and all assignments were literally taken from CS188. Practise midterm and finals were useless.
This guys makes exams out of nowhere. he himself doesn't know what he is teaching. after he made exams on paper this semester its no longer a gpa booster. Assignments are all Berkeley ones.

No comment, never trust his samples or questions given to practice cuz his midterms and final are nowhere close to what we have.
Wont recommend

Assignments worth over half the grade and last two have auto graders which was nice. Pop quizzes sucked but aren't exactly closed book. Midterm and final includes really hard questions. Boring lectures, and some given study supplies have wrong answers which doesn't help.
Just avoid at all costs for your own good.

If there was a rating below 1, I could have given him that. He is the worst professor I have ever taken. The course he teaches has been copied from Berkeley's CS188 course. He does not know a single word what he says in the class and even provides wrong answers for practice materials. Stay away from him if possible.

Bro expects us to know partial derivates for the final exam when he didn't even teach it, nor is it a course prerequisite. Most TAs are awful, never replying to emails and no-show in office hours. Pop quizzes in big 2025ðŸ’”. Everything is copied from Berkeley, from lecture slides to assignments to exams. Absolute clown show ðŸ¤¡.
Half of his answers on the answer sheet are wrong, I have no clue what to do. Please help.

Awful professor, he has no clue what he is taking about. Everything is copied from Berkley - from the lectures slides, to assignments, to quizzes, to exams. Everything he says is incoherent as well, we still have no idea what is on our final or the cheat sheet for it.

If youre genuinely fond of AI and wanna learn. please, please DONT take this course with this dude. he's gonna brutally murder the passion you have for AI. My guy doesn't even know what he's teaching just yaps during lectures read through the slides and when you ask a question, professionally dodges the question and moves on. DONT!

Ahmedreza Nezami is truly the professor of all time. Students should marvel in his glory, but instead they seethe that he does nothing and gets PAID $_$. He implements stochastic learning in REAL LIFE, with unexpected procedures around every corner!

k-consistency? He is OK consistently to me! Just look at his reviews, many success stories.
Lectures are alright, he gives good homework questions that are similar to exam questions which is useful.
bro copy everything from berkeley, waste of time taking his course
Bro does the minimum to get his paycheck
No one knows what this guy is doing, literally disastrous. He won't teach properly, of course, because he doesn't know how to, and he also won't post materials unless reminded.
lectures are absolute cinema, take this class just to experience reza's chaos.
this N doesnt know what hes doing

One of the craziest instructors of all time. Copies everything from CS188 but is terrible at teaching. Never explains concepts clearly and chicken scratches on the slides. Save your time by skipping his lectures on weeks with no quizzes (u have to guess) and watching CS188 lectures instead. Luckily, the TAs were very helpful and lenient on marking.
If you want to learn about real-life stochastic applications then this guy is the man!!

This professor does not seem to know what he is talking about most of the time. He is the most confusing professor of all time. He is messy, and all his content is stolen from Berkeley's CS 188. Although his materials are stolen, he still manages to get them wrong. His assignments were all stolen from Berkeley, and he still manages to break them?
Learned nothing, got my A+ and dipped. W Reza, my Persian goat, who has mastered the art of yapping

Lectures could be more concise, feels like we stayed on the same slides for ages. Course content was just from Berkeley CS 188. Assignment instructions were often unclear and seemed to be missing something. Things were honestly ok, I had a solid ~90% up until the end but the final exam made me wanna off myself
This guy is on another plane of existence
Although lectures can be pretty unclear, the marking does make up for it. Learning the content ahead will get you further in this course.
He does not know what he teaches
GOAT

If you enjoy debugging confusing, spaghetti codebases, this course is perfect! Don't let the title of this course fool you with Ahmedreza, because you will learn everything that isn't AI. The lectures are just extremely bland rip-offs of CS 188 at Berkeley. 

The only positive thing about this class is that it was a GPA booster in the end.

Prof Nezami is an inspiration. He taught me that you don't have to know how to do a job to get paid for it, and that you can give online exams while banning computers. He is a master at inciting confusion, chaos, and anxiety. Clearly, we do not comprehend his higher-levels of thought. I hope one day to achieve his level of greatness.
Get out. Everything from Berkley. The course is just an emotional rollercoaster. Decided to give a final online to be taken in class but not allow anyone to bring a computer and only a cheat sheet.
This man is the man
Great instructor! Every encounter with him, online or in-person, can bring tons of surprises! Being able to predict and prepare for uncertainties is such an invaluable skill I learned from him.
Believe me, this course will be your easiest course in CMPT 300 level!

Professor Nezami is flexible. His lectures are interesting, although he was a bit slow at the beginning, he catches up. One of the assignments was tricky, but he changed the requirements and grading scheme in favor of the students, so no complaints. Overall, I enjoy his lectures and attend all of them.

Ahmedreza Nezami is truly an inspiration! His ability to communicate is impressive, shocking even! We followed the cs188 material, covering search for the first 8 weeks, followed by constraint satisfaction, reinforcement learning, adversarial search, bayes nets, perceptron systems, and machine learning. Taking his course has truly changed my life!

Professor Nezami teaching ability is beyond just mere exams and assignments, as he gets the students to learn about stochastic principles and uncertainty in real life scenarios, with ever-changing due dates and requirements. You will have to adopt principles of AI in your own learning, which greatly enhances the experience.

This guy is the guy! He went to lectures and said something! (I think, wasn't there). A word of caution however, you may need to bring your own final to the class! His printer doesn't work! I personally brought a coloring book to show how I understood constraint satisfaction on coloring maps or something like that!
Doesn't know what Ai is. Never too sure what to teach like a toxic gf. If you know how to code you pass the course. Any course you take it would be debugging 101

This professor is one of the professors of all time, the negative reviews are LYING to you! Throughout the course he has been in class, and he has done stuff. Further, he also looks pretty swag. I am confident that a course with Ahmedreza Nezami will truly be an inspirational experience, impacting your view on education for the rest of your life!
This is course is insane. The prof is game changer
You never know what could happen with this guy.
He's the man
Best prof ever. Highly flexible and unorganized. Exams are take home, depending on mood he might cancel it.
Man, this guy took it to the next level. Never had a professor like this.

Ahmedreza Nezami has no idea what he's even teaching. Lectures are a whole lot of nothing useful. You are much better off watching CS188 Berkeley lectures as they are more entertaining and MUCH better in terms of content. Assignments are incredibly vague and few guidelines. Low workload but I learned absolutely nothing from the lectures and prof.
